criteria: Encourages peers to adopt safe behaviors.
Applies safe behaviors in practical situations.
descriptions: Does not demonstrate understanding of safe behaviors or their importance.
Shows limited understanding of safe behaviors; struggles to identify them.
Identifies some safe behaviors but struggles to explain their importance or application.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of safe behaviors and can explain their importance in some contexts.
Clearly understands and explains various safe behaviors and their importance in different settings.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of safe behaviors, their importance, and can adapt their application to novel situations.
Does not encourage peers to practice safe behaviors.
Rarely encourages safe behaviors among peers; may passively observe unsafe actions.
Sometimes encourages peers to adopt safe behaviors, but inconsistently or without explanation.
Regularly encourages peers to adopt safe behaviors, providing basic explanations or reminders.
Actively and consistently encourages peers to practice safe behaviors, providing clear explanations and positive reinforcement.
Serves as a role model, consistently advocating for safe behaviors among peers and taking initiative to correct unsafe actions, providing leadership in promoting a safe environment.
Does not apply safe behaviors in practical situations.
Rarely applies safe behaviors independently; requires constant reminders and guidance.
Applies safe behaviors inconsistently, especially in new or challenging situations.
Consistently applies safe behaviors in common situations, demonstrating competence and awareness.
Proactively applies safe behaviors in a variety of settings, adapting their approach as needed to maintain safety.
Masterfully applies safe behaviors in all situations, consistently prioritizing safety and serving as a resource for others.
